text: {"type":"task_assignment","taskId":"8","subject":"tokenizer-engineer","description":"You are joining the core-engine-compute team to integrate the tokenizer with the backend.\n\n**Your Ta","assignedBy":"tokenizer-engineer","timestamp":"2026-02-18T20:58:29.849Z"}

{"type":"task_assignment","taskId":"3","subject":"Tokenizer Integration - Wire llama-cpp-2 tokenize/detokenize functions","description":"Phase 3: Tokenizer Integration with Model Backend

**Objective**: Connect the tokenizer to the llama-cpp-2 backend for encoding input and decoding output.

**Tasks**:
1. Review existing TokenizerWrapper structure and interface
2. Integrate llama-cpp-2's tokenize() function for input encoding
3. Integrate llama-cpp-2's detokenize() function for output decoding
4. Update TokenizerWrapper::encode() to call real model tokenizer
5. Update TokenizerWrapper::decode() to call real model detokenizer
6. Handle tokenizer errors and edge cases (BOS/EOS tokens, special tokens)
7. Add integration tests with real models

**Dependencies**: Task 2 (llama-cpp-2 Backend)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- TokenizerWrapper calls llama-cpp-2 tokenizer functions
- Input text encodes to token IDs correctly
- Token IDs decode back to text
- Special tokens handled appropriately
- All integration tests pass
- End-to-end text‚Üítokens‚Üíinference‚Üítokens‚Üítext works","assignedBy":"tokenizer-engineer","timestamp":"2026-02-18T20:59:12.761Z"}

Excellent prep work! Your integration plan for Task #3 is well-scoped. While waiting for Task #2, you could:

1. Write comprehensive unit tests for the tokenizer roundtrip scenarios (before connecting to real llama-cpp-2)
2. Stub out the implementation with clear TODO comments for the real tokenize()/detokenize() calls
3. Create test fixtures for BOS/EOS token handling edge cases
4. Review the llama-cpp-2 bindings to understand the exact API signatures you'll use

This way you'll be ready to plug in the real backend immediately once Task #2 completes.
summary: Suggesting prep work for tokenizer while blocked

text:
üéâ **Task #2 COMPLETE** - You're now unblocked!

The backend-engineer has successfully integrated llama-cpp-2 with:
- Real model loading from GGUF files
- `LlamaBackendInner::tokenize()` and `detokenize()` methods ready for you
- Full token streaming support via `TokenStreamSender`
- Section 4 Razor compliant code (all tests passing)

**You can now proceed with Task #3 - Tokenizer Integration:**

Your plan was solid. Now wire `TokenizerWrapper`:
1. Add `LlamaBackendInner` reference to TokenizerWrapper (feature-gated)
2. Update `encode()` to call `backend.tokenize()`
3. Update `decode()` to call `backend.detokenize()`
4. Handle BOS/EOS token logic
5. Provide fallback stubs for non-gguf builds
6. Add integration tests for roundtrip verification

The backend methods are in `src/engine/gguf/backend.rs`. Full details available in your task description.
